availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
HEAD-QUARTERS 16TH ARMY CORPS,
MEMPHIS, TENN., December 22, 1863.
Special Orders,
No. 328. } Extract III.

Pursuant to instructions from the General in Chief U. S. A., all action, under General Orders No. 157, current series frOm these Head-Quarters, in so much of the State of Kentucky as is included in the 16th Army Corps, is hereby suspended, and persons drafted under the above orders will be released from enrolment and service.

Brig.-Gen'l A. J. Smith, Commanding District of Columbus, will enter into correspondence with his Excellency Governor Bramlette, and will extend all required assistance to the authorities of the State of Kentucky and to officers of the Provost Marshal General's Department, in enforcing the regular Draft in Kentucky.

By order of MAJ.-GEN. S. A. HURLBUT,
T. H. HARRIS,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
T. H. Harris,
Assistant Adjutant General.
